page.title: 02ENTERTAINMENT IN LAMERTON.
page.content: There is a lot to do in Lamerton.The Blacksmith's Arms is a pub.The Blacksmiths Arms used be known as the Fortescue Arms due to the link with the Fortescue family, who owned, along with the Duke of Bedford, much of the land around it. The name Fortescue Arms was changed to the Blacksmiths Arms. This was because of the blacksmith,s shop over the road.The pub was once a resting house for monks on their way to Tavistock Abbey.Nowadays it sells drinks and meals to all kinds of people. Outside it has a carpark,beer garden, childrens sand pit and a childrens room inside.The pub and its activities blends in with the other leisure clubs in the village. There is bingo, Euchre, which is played in the pub, darts,pool, snooker and discos.
